text: True presence isn't an escape from life—it's a radical acceptance of what's actually happening right now, including your resistance to it.
The part of you that's judging your anxiety? That's just more anxiety wearing a spiritual costume.
Your shadow isn't your enemy. It's the treasure chest you buried because someone told you it was too much.
The ego loves a good spiritual identity. 'I'm so awakened' is just another way to avoid being human.
What if the thing you're most ashamed of is actually your superpower in disguise?
Presence isn't a feeling. It's what remains when you stop trying to feel different.
The pain-body feeds on drama, but it starves in stillness. Don't fight it—just stop feeding it.
Your triggers are your teachers. The bigger the reaction, the bigger the gift waiting to be unwrapped.
